alert.note: Alert for Cuyama Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 07 at 9:25AM PST until January 07 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...HARD FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, north winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph expected. For the Hard Freeze Watch, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 24 degrees are possible. * WHERE...Cuyama Valley. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 7 PM PST this evening. For the Hard Freeze Watch, from late tonight through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects and make driving difficult, especially for drivers of high profile vehicles. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Freezing conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly.
